title: Inside Ben Johnson’s journey from math wiz to Bears head coach
content: As Johnson prepares for his head coaching debut, those who knew him growing up aren't surprised by his ascent. Here's why.

title: J.J. McCarthy has the potential to be 'elite': Inside his unique pre-game rituals
content: Justin Jefferson said McCarthy, who makes his NFL debut Monday against the Bears, "has the winning attitude."

title: 49ers' Kittle out weeks; Purdy could miss Week 2
content: The 49ers will be without star tight end George Kittle for multiple weeks due to a hamstring injury, while Brock Purdy might need to sit out Week 2 after hurting a shoulder and toe in the team's Week 1 win in Seattle.

title: Giants sticking with Wilson as QB1 vs. Cowboys
content: Russell Wilson will remain the Giants' starting quarterback for Sunday's game against the Cowboys, coach Brian Daboll said Monday.

title: Sister of Wolves' Reid allegedly slain by boyfriend
content: The sister of Timberwolves player Naz Reid was fatally shot at a New Jersey apartment complex, and her boyfriend has been charged with murder.

title: Ex-Fins CB says Colts forced Tua into 'panic mode'
content: Former Dolphins and current Colts corner Xavien Howard said the game plan Sunday was to take away QB Tua Tagovailoa's first read and get him into "panic mode."

title: Phillies expect Turner (hamstring) back by playoffs
content: Phillies star shortstop Trea Turner has a Grade 1 hamstring strain but is expected back for the postseason.

title: Senator warns WNBA to stay out of Sun sale talks
content: U.S. Senator Richard Blumenthal (D-CT) sent a letter to the WNBA on Monday warning the league to stay out of negotiations between the Mohegan tribe and prospective new ownership groups for the Connecticut Sun.

title: Real or not? 14 contenders, 14 reasons they can -- or can't? -- win the World Series
content: Lack of power? Bullpen holes? Injured stars? Why each contender's biggest weakness will -- or won't -- sink them in October.

title: Three young arms are here to carry the Mets into October
content: The rookie trio of Nolan McLean, Jonah Tong and Brandon Sproat look to lift New York's fortunes this season.

title: What is real -- and what isn't -- from NFL Week 1: Barnwell on the Lions, Colts, Dolphins and Jets
content: Let's size up the legitimacy of the Lions' offensive woes, two run-game surges, Aaron Rodgers' big day and the Dolphins' ineptitude in Week 1.

title: Ranking first-year WNBA coaches who have beaten -- or fallen short of -- expectations
content: Natalie Nakase has the Valkyries playoff-bound. Here's how all seven first-time WNBA head coaches have done.

title: Vote for Week 1's top performance: Josh Allen, Aaron Rodgers, Emeka Egbuka, Daniel Jones
content: Cast your "Himmy" award vote between Josh Allen, Aaron Rodgers, Emeka Egbuka and Daniel Jones for Week 1's top performance.

title: Answering the biggest questions of Week 1: What's more jarring, the Bills' comeback or Baltimore's collapse?
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 1.

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 1: Which QB situations are most messy?
content: Will Jaxson Dart take Russell Wilson's job soon? Are the Dolphins doomed? We sized up Week 1 overreactions.

title: As Carlos Alcaraz wins another US Open, can anyone challenge these Big Two?
content: With the past eight major titles, Alcaraz and Sinner are clearly dominant. Can anyone compete with them?

title: Week 1 injury update: George Kittle, Xavier Worthy at risk of missing time
content: Stephania Bell examines the outlooks for Kittle (hamstring), Worthy (shoulder) and more for Week 2 and beyond.

title: Nine months to the World Cup: Does Pochettino know his best XI?
content: If Pochettino doesn't know his USMNT XI, is he willing to commit to one soon before he runs out of time ahead of the World Cup?

title: One year after Canada's Olympics cheating scandal, the once-renowned program moves on
content: It's been about a year since Canada was accused of cheating at the Olympics. With a new coach and lofty goals for the 2027 Women's World Cup, players are still trying to move on.

title: Best of NFL Week 1 tunnel fits, featuring Caleb Williams rocking a Brian Urlacher jersey
content: NFL stars didn't just show up to play -- they showed up in style. From Joe Burrow to Jayden Daniels, here are the best looks from the first Sunday of the season.

title: Mike Tyson to return to stage with 'Return of the Mike' one-man show
content: Tyson will perform in four cities prior to his exhibition fight with Floyd Mayweather Jr. next spring.

title: Canelo Alvarez vs. Terence Crawford: All you need to know about Saturday's fight
content: Andreas Hale explains why Canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford are fighting, what it means for boxing and more.

title: How McLaren is managing Norris, Piastri ahead of final stretch in championship
content: From Hungary 2024 to Monza 2025, here's how McLaren has navigated team orders and tension between title-chasing teammates Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: True or false? What we think we know about SEC QBs, the Big 12, Oregon and more
content: The start of the 2025 season has been a delightful mess. Bill Connelly tries to make sense of what we've seen.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes from Kiper, Miller and Reid: Early concerns around top QBs?
content: John Mateer rising? Questions around LaNorris Sellers and Cade Klubnik? We have updates on NFL draft prospects through CFB Week 2.

title: Betting buzz: Sunday under-whelming for sportsbooks, bettors
content: The Jets-Steelers game was the exception in the NFL on Sunday when almost every game went under the point total.

title: College football betting lines: Ranked USF looks to upset another in-state rival
content: This week's odds and FPI predictions for Texas A&M-Notre Dame, South Florida-Miami and every Top 25 matchup.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Federico Chiesa linked to Turkey move
content: Besiktas have made an approach for Liverpool's Federico Chiesa. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: West Bengal BJP holds protests over burning of Rabindranath Tagore’s photograph by TMCP cadres
content: A video posted by several leaders of the BJP on social media showed Trinamool Congress Chattra Parishad students under leadership of Chanchal College president of the student outfit A.B. Soyel attempting to burn a photograph of the poet along with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Supreme Court asks Madhya Pradesh government to pay ₹25 lakh to convict for over 4 years in jail beyond term
content: Sohan Singh Yadav was only released from Sagar Central Jail on June 6 this year, after advocate Mahfooz A. Nazki wrote to the prison authorities and the M.P. State Legal Services Authority flagging the matter

title: 3 former BJP, AGP MLAs join Congress ahead of Assam Assembly polls
content: Former BJP MLAs Binanda Saikia and Mansingh Rongpi, and AGP MLA Satyabrata Kalita, were inducted into the party in the presence of senior leaders, including Assam Congress chief Gaurav Gogoi

title: India, China should counter unfair U.S. tariffs: Chinese envoy
content: Xu Feihong said the U.S. is using the tariffs as a kind of “weapon” to extract “exorbitant” costs from various countries, and India and China must cooperate with each other to navigate the situation

title: Maratha quota activist asks government to distribute caste certificate before September 17
content: After Mr. Patil’s five-day hunger strike in Mumbai, the Maharashtra government issued the GR on September 2, implementing the Hyderabad Gazette to provide Kunbi caste certificates to Marathas of Marathwada

title: After Nizam, successive Congress govts ensured drinking water supply for Hyderabad, says CM Revanth Reddy
content: Foundation laid for Godavari Phase II & III at Gandipet to bring additional 17.5 tmc ft of water to Hyderabad, rejuvenate the Musi river and meet the city’s rising drinking water needs by 2027

title: The relevance of a robust third political force in Bengal in run-up to Assembly poll
content: There is an urgent need to shift the debate away from communal politics and instead focus on pressing issues, making the third alternative more relevant than ever in West Bengal’s politics

title: TMC offering me money, ministerial posts to join the party: ISF MLA
content: A TMC MLA came up with an offer for me to join the party and I was arrested on the same day, says Nawsad Siddique; Suvendu questions timing

title: Consumers eager for price cuts to GST-exempt milk-based products
content: While many hope the reduction in cost will make the products affordable for everyone, there has been no information in this regard from Aavin and the private brands so far

title: Kancheepuram DSP remanded in custody for failing to take action in SC/ST Act case
content: High drama unfolded as the DSP did not board his official car to go to the sub-jail, as ordered by the Principal District and Sessions Judge. Instead, accompanied by a few police personnel, he was seen sprinting towards another vehicle. However, half-an-hour later, he emerged in a police vehicle and proceeded to the sub-jail

title: Police not filing FIR against Waqf chairperson over Hazratbal incident, will approach court: PDP
content: PDP and NC parties say that those who took the decision to place the National Emblem on a plaque in a religious place should be held accountable and also demand withdrawal of FIR against locals

title: BJD, BRS, Akali Dal to abstain from vice-presidential election
content: This will not impact electoral arithmetic that is leaning in favour of ruling party candidate C.P. Radhakrishnan; both sides conduct meetings and mock polls on election eve to ensure maximum attendance of their MPs; all eyes on Shiv Sena (UBT)

title: Srushti Fertility Centre case: three government doctors placed under suspension
content: Health Minister feels that the continuation of these doctors in duties might cause hindrance to the investigation

title: Parliamentary panel to be briefed ahead of EU-India FTA talks
content: Officials are expected to help build political consensus over FTA talks with European countries; EU trade negotiators are in Delhi for meetings, where both sides are expected to agree on an accelerated plan for talks every month

title: SC allows Medha Patkar to withdraw plea in defamation case against Delhi L-G
content: Patkar’s counsel withdrew the plea after the top court declined to interfere with the Delhi High Court’s rejection of her request to examine an additional witness in a defamation case against Delhi L-G V. K. Saxena

title: Economic practices must be fair, transparent: Jaishankar
content: He was addressing a virtual BRICS summit convened by Brazil to discuss trade disruptions by U.S.’ tariffs; Global South experiences deterioration in food, energy, fertilizer security, he says and calls for urgent resolution to ongoing conflicts

title: Supreme Court transfers to itself pleas challenging Online Gaming Act
content: Arguing for a transfer, Centre said multiple proceedings before various High Courts would add to the confusion, especially if the judgments contradict each other

title: PM Modi to cast first vote in vice-presidential election
content: The NDA has nominated Maharashtra Governor C.P. Radhakrishnan and the Opposition’s candidate is Justice (retired) B. Sudershan Reddy for the election

title: Translated collection of Bhil folk tales to be out soon
content: The stories are available as an e-booklet on the Adi Vaani website and app; fighting casteism is a recurring theme in the collection

title: Supreme Court hears Kerala doctor’s petition on ‘brain-stem death’
content: The Court said it could not be expected to legislate or ‘second-guess’ Parliament’s definition in the 1994 law on when ‘life ceases and death begins’

title: 89% of the investment from Germany and U.K. MoUs are meant for expansion, says Anbumani Ramadoss
content: Out of the ₹15,516 crore in investment, claimed to have been clinched during Chief Minister M.K. Stalin’s foreign trip,  ₹13,815 crore is meant for the expansion of the projects already operating in Tamil Nadu, says the PMK leader

title: Prince Harry Returns To UK Amid Rumours Of King Charles Meeting
content: Prince Harry said the world had thrown a few challenges as he made his first return to Britain in five months for a week of engagements, starting with an awards ceremony for seriously ill children.

title: Israeli Strike Hits Near Syrian City Of Homs
content: Israeli air strikes hit areas of the central and western Syrian cities of Homs and Latakia late Monday, state news agency SANA reported.

title: KTR Decides To Boycott Vice President Election
content: BRS working president KT Rama Rao (KTR) on Monday launched a scathing attack on state and central governments about the shortage of urea, asserting that his party has decided not to participate in the Vice President election.

title: Democrats Release Trump's Alleged Birthday Note To Epstein
content: A note allegedly from Donald Trump wishing late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein happy birthday -- and alluding to their "wonderful secret" -- was released Monday by Democratic lawmakers, after the US president denied it existed.

title: Numbers In Its Favour For Veep Election, NDA Still Keeping Strict Eye On MPs
content: The ruling NDA is ready with an elaborate plan for the election of the Vice President today, in which Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan is running against the Opposition candidate, Retired Supreme Court judge Justice Sudershan Reddy.

title: Nepal Lifts Ban On Social Media Apps After Deadly Protests
content: The Nepal government was the first to blink. In a late-night decision, the government lifted the ban on social media apps after protests, led by Gen Z, turned violent, resulting in clashes with the police that led to the death of 19 people.

title: 19 Killed In Massive Nepal Protest, Home Minister Resigns
content: At least 19 people, including a 12-year-old, were killed and more than 300 were injured in violent clashes in Nepal's Kathmandu as Gen-Z protestors took to the streets to protest against corruption and the government's ban on social media apps.

title: We Contend With Terror and Hypocrisy of International Community: Israel Minister
content: India and Israel had common beginnings as British colonies and today, both face the threat of Islamic terror, Israel finance minister Bezalel Smotrich told NDTV in an exclusive interview today.

title: Ukraine Says Russia Fired Ballistic Missile At Kyiv Government Building
content: Russia used an Iskander ballistic missile in an attack that damaged a Ukrainian government building in Kyiv at the weekend, an official said Monday.

title: Why Nepal Banned Social Media, And Why That's Not Only Trigger For Protests
content: Three people have died and more than 100 have been injured after Thousands of young Nepalese citizens hit the streets to protest the KP Sharma Oli government's move to ban 26 social media platforms, including Facebook, YouTube, and X.

title: Nepal Protest Live Updates: Social Media Ban Lifted, 19 Protesters Dead
content: Live Updates: At least 19 protesters were killed after Nepal police fired rubber bullets, tear gas and water cannons to disperse demonstrators demanding the government lift its ban on social media and tackle corruption.

title: RSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale Admitted To AIIMS Jodhpur
content: RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale was admitted to AIIMS Jodhpur on Monday after he suddenly fell ill due to high blood pressure, doctors in the hospital said.

title: Global Warming Linked To Consumption Of Sugary Drinks, Ice Cream
content: People consuming more sugary drinks and ice cream on warmer days, particularly those with less money, could pose a growing threat to health as climate change drives up temperatures, new research warned Monday.

title: London's Heathrow Terminal Check-In Evacuated Over 'Incident'
content: Heathrow's Terminal 4's check-in area was "closed and evacuated" Monday evening as emergency services responded to an "incident", the airport's operator said on social media.

title: 'Never Seen Anything Like It': What Trump's Favorite Phrase Says About His Presidency
content: The United States is going to build a new missile defense system "the likes of which nobody's ever seen before."

title: Flood-hit India, Pakistan face rising basmati prices amid crop losses
content: Heavy rains and widespread flooding in basmati ricegrowing regions of India and Pakistan have raised concerns over output of the premium

title: Video: 8 Dead After Train Slams Into Double-Deck Bus In Mexico
content: A train slammed into a double-deck bus northwest of Mexico City early Monday, killing at least eight people and injuring 45, authorities said.

title: New Banksy Artwork Challenges UK's Protest Crackdown
content: British street artist Banksy on Monday took aim at the UK's crackdown on protesters with a new work outside the Royal Courts of Justice in London, adding fuel to...

title: Israel Vows 'Hurricane' Of Strikes On Gaza To Force Hamas To Accept Surrender Demand
content: Israel said it would ramp up airstrikes on Gaza on Monday in a "mighty hurricane", to serve as a last warning to Hamas that it will destroy the enclave unless fighters accept a demand

title: Pregnant Woman Dies, Husband In Hospital After Consuming Poison: UP Cops
content: A pregnant woman died after allegedly consuming poison along with her husband following a domestic dispute, police here said on Monday.

title: Naga council in Manipur seeks to enforce trade embargo
content: It is likely to disrupt movement of goods trucks on NH-2, which connects Manipur’s capital to Nagaland

title: 111 persons have died in rain-related incidents since April 1
content: As many as 111 persons have lost their lives in rain-related incidents in Karnataka between April 1 and September 7, even as the government has estimated the compensation to be around ₹561 crore

title: Thrissur roars in Pulikkali frenzy as 450 tigers set Swaraj Round ablaze
content: Tens of thousands of people throng the streets as painted tigers, floats, and dazzling lights transform the city into a living canvas of tradition and spectacle

title: Yellow Line to induct fourth train set by end of the week
content: The Yellow Line was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on August 10 and opened for public the next day. However, services began with only three trains, resulting in long intervals of 25 minutes between trips

title: Army intensifies flood relief efforts; Modi to review situation in Punjab
content: With 126 rescue columns deployed, troops have rescued over 21,500 civilians, provided medical aid to nearly 9,700 people, and delivered 23,500 kg of relief supplies

title: Thampu provides free umbrellas to Attappady tribal students
content: The ESAF Foundation sponsored the Karthumbi brand umbrellas made by tribal women under the banner of Thampu

title: CPI, farmer leaders demand government to take steps against shortage of urea
content: There is a shortage of seven lakh metric tonnes of fertiliser this year when compared to last year, says CPI District Secretary

title: Time to make the hard choices needed to conclude trade deal: U.S.-India Business Council
content: The Council representing hundreds of leading American and Indian companies says the two countries have too much at stake in this era of rising geostrategic competition to abandon the progress made together

title: YSRCP accuses Naidu government of temple land grab in Machilipatnam
content: Velampalli Srinivas says the party will launch a legal battle to protect temple property and demanded criminal action against those responsible for the levelling works

title: Minister dares YSRCP leaders for a debate on fertilizer supply in A.P.
content: No truth in YSRCP’s allegation that fertilizer scarcity crippled agricultural activity in the State, says Kolusu Parthasarathy

title: Works to restore Kaleshwaram Barrages to begin after flood season: Minister
content: Uttam Kumar Reddy asks officials to get proposals on Tummidihetti Barrage ready, as Govt. committed to complete Pranahita-Chevella project

title: Karnataka High Court imposes fine of ₹2 lakh on 72-year-old woman for filing plea to harass police by falsely claiming that they failed to trace her missing son
content: The High Court of Karnataka has imposed a fine of ₹2 lakh on a 72-year-old woman for filing a habeas corpus petition by falsely portraying that her son was missing and that the Bengaluru city police had failed to act properly on her complaint to trace him

title: BJP criticises Opposition’s V-P candidate meeting Lalu Prasad, alleges hypocrisy
content: BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad accuses Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge of insulting a Karnataka farmer in distress due to his ruined crop

title: From Avatar to tiger-fish, Thrissur’s Pulikkali tableaux win applauds
content: Nine troupes roll out spectacular floats that dazzle the crowds with their creativity, social messages, and sheer visual grandeur

title: VP polls: Radhakrishnan vs Reddy - What’s happened so far, who has edge?
content: The vice-presidential election is scheduled for Tuesday, with NDA nominee CP Radhakrishnan expected to win against opposition candidate B Sudershan Reddy. NDA's strong majority in the electoral college, along with support from other parties, positions Radhakrishnan for a comfortable victory. Polling will occur in Parliament, and the results are anticipated late in the evening, marking a significant political event.

title: Social media ban: After violent protests, Nepal restores Facebook, X
content: Nepal's government reversed its ban on 26 social media platforms following widespread protests in Kathmandu. Thousands of young Nepalis demonstrated against the decision, leading to violent clashes with police. Tragically, the unrest resulted in 19 fatalities and over 300 injuries as police used force to disperse the crowds.

title: Nations Cup: India create history! Podium finish on debut with win over Oman
content: India made history at the CAFA Nations Cup, securing a bronze medal in their debut appearance. They triumphed over Oman 3-2 in a penalty shootout after a 1-1 draw, with Udanta Singh Kumam's late header canceling out Oman's opener. Gurpreet Singh Sandhu's decisive save in the shootout sealed the victory, marking a remarkable achievement for the Blue Tigers.

title: Ukrainian president Zelenskyy sees US tariffs on India as ‘right idea’
content: Amidst US-India tariff tensions, Ukrainian President Zelensky endorsed US tariffs on nations dealing with Russia, despite Ukraine's reliance on Indian-refined Russian oil. White House trade advisor Peter Navarro criticized India's oil purchases, prompting backlash and accusations of anti-BRICS rhetoric.

title: Youngest woman billionaire on dropping out; how parents reacted, money lessons
content: Lucy Guo, the youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her success to her frugal upbringing. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship. Guo's entrepreneurial spirit emerged early, hustling on the playground and selling virtual items online.

title: In most states, majority of girls marry after 18, says government report
content: The SRS statistical report 2023 indicates a slight increase in the mean age at effective marriage for females in India, reaching 22.9 years. While most states see girls marrying after 18, West Bengal, Jharkhand, and Chhattisgarh still have notable instances of child marriage. Significant rural-urban disparities persist, with rural areas reporting a mean age of 22.4 years compared to 24.

title: J&K's AAP MLA Malik jailed under PSA; political parties decry action
content: Mehraj Malik, AAP's J&K unit chief, was detained under the Public Safety Act amid protests by government employees who accused him of abusing the Doda DC. This action has sparked condemnation from political parties, including Omar Abdullah, who called it an assault on democracy.

title: Meet Rohit Kumar, a Delhi labourer, finishes 2nd in Spiti marathon
content: Rohit Kumar, a daily wage labourer from Delhi, defies odds by excelling in marathons. Despite financial constraints after his medical studies in Russia were cut short, the 32-year-old has achieved podium finishes in multiple races, including a recent high-altitude marathon in Spiti.

title: Red Sea Cables Cut: Microsoft shares update; services affected Middle East, Asia
content: Undersea cable cuts in the Red Sea have significantly disrupted internet services across regions including India, Saudi Arabia, Pakistan, and the UAE, causing slowed connectivity and increased latency. The disruptions, attributed to failures affecting the SMW4 and IMEWE cable systems near Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, highlight the Red Sea's critical role in global internet data flow, impacting cloud and network services.

title: ‘US has long benefitted’: China on 50% tariffs on India; calls them ‘unfair'
content: Chinese Ambassador Xu Feihong advocated for stronger Sino-Indian ties, denouncing "unilateralism and bullying" and inviting Indian companies to invest in China, while seeking a fair business environment in India for Chinese firms. He criticized US tariffs and affirmed that Sino-Indian relations remain unaffected by third parties.

title: Hazratbal row: Omar seeks apology from waqf chair Andrabi
content: Following the installation of a plaque with the National Emblem at Hazratbal shrine, political tensions rise in Jammu and Kashmir. Omar Abdullah criticizes the Waqf Board, while Mehbooba Mufti demands an FIR against its chairperson.

title: Bears vs Vikings MNF: rookie QBs clash; key injuries, bold Week 1 picks
content: The Chicago Bears are set to host the Minnesota Vikings on Monday Night Football, but both teams are dealing with significant injuries. All eyes are on quarterbacks J.J. McCarthy and Caleb Williams as they navigate their teams. The Vikings are slightly favored, but a strong performance from Williams and the Bears' offense could lead to an upset.

title: Anthropic CEO repeats his AI warning which created 'outrage' and sparked debate
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei predicts AI will eliminate entry-level white-collar jobs in law, consulting, administration, and finance within five years. He claims AI is already proficient at repetitive tasks and improving rapidly. Amodei reveals CEOs privately view AI as a cost-cutting tool, contradicting public narratives.

title: Teacher who made girl do 100 squats sacked, booked
content: In Chhattisgarh's Surguja district, a DAV Public School teacher was fired after severely punishing an eight-year-old student. The teacher forced the class 2 girl to do 100 squats and beat her with a stick, causing serious leg injuries. Police have filed a case against her under BNS and the Juvenile Justice Act.

title: Rohit Sharma spotted at hospital late night, leaves fans worried - Watch
content: Concerns arose among fans after Rohit Sharma's recent hospital visit, though he had cleared a fitness test in Bengaluru. Having been absent since the 2025 Champions Trophy win, Sharma, along with Virat Kohli, is set to return for the ODI series against Australia.

title: J&K: Two soldiers killed in encounter; terrorists gunned down
content: In a fierce gunfight in Kulgam, south Kashmir, Subedar Perbhat Gaur and Lance Naik Narender Sindhu of the Indian Army were killed, raising the year's security toll in J&K to 19. The clash, initiated by a joint search operation in Guddar forests, resulted in the death of two terrorists, one suspected to be a Pakistani national.

title: ‘Phillies Karen’ identified, fired after taking Bader HR ball from kid
content: During a Phillies vs. Marlins game, Harrison Bader's home run ball was caught by Drew Feltwell, who gifted it to his son Lincoln. A woman demanded the ball, sparking outrage online and earning her the moniker "Phillies Karen." Despite mistaken identity claims involving Leslie-Ann Kravitz and Cheryl Richardson-Wagner, the woman's true identity remains unconfirmed.

title: D’Andre Swift injury update: Bears RB active; starts vs Vikings tonight
content: D'Andre Swift is set to start for the Chicago Bears against the Minnesota Vikings tonight, with coach Ben Johnson confirming his active status. Swift is expected to handle a significant workload as both a rusher and receiver, especially with Roschon Johnson's questionable status due to a foot injury. High expectations surround Swift as he aims to anchor Chicago's offense.

title: Taylor Swift severs Blake Lively ties; Kelce wedding; drama unfolds
content: Taylor Swift is reportedly planning to formally distance herself from Blake Lively, potentially relinquishing her godmother role amid growing tension stemming from the 'It Ends With Us' legal battle. Swift aims to set boundaries and focus on her relationship with Travis Kelce, avoiding further entanglement in the Lively-Reynolds drama. This decision marks a significant shift in their once close friendship.

title: 'Too funny': Navarro's poll on X falls flat; Trump aide against guns for India
content: Peter Navarro's poll on X regarding Indian influence backfired spectacularly, with a majority voting against his viewpoint. Community Notes debunked his claims, highlighting US imports of Russian goods and the growth of US-India trade. Navarro lashed out, accusing foreign interests of manipulating social media, prompting accusations of hypocrisy and misinformation.

title: 'Trade must stay open': India to Brics amid US tariffs; big 'don't complicate' message
content: During a Brics meeting, S Jaishankar emphasized the need for a stable and predictable trade environment, addressing concerns over trade disruptions and advocating for resilient supply chains. He criticized increasing trade barriers and linking trade measures to non-trade matters, urging Brics nations to review trade flows and promote sustainable trade practices.

title: Taylor Swift skips NFL opener: security, album promo; Kelce plays solo
content: Travis Kelce's season opener in Brazil against the Chargers saw a notable absence: Taylor Swift. Despite recent engagement buzz, logistical challenges, including security and travel costs, kept Swift away. No other Chiefs' partners made the trip either. Brazilian fans, anticipating her arrival based on local media reports, still showed their support, hoping to see her at future games.

title: Hyundai raid, visa hurdles: How Trump's Made-in-US dream is being paralysed - explained
content: US President Donald Trump's 'Made-in-USA' dreams face setbacks as immigration raids, like the one at the Hyundai-LG battery facility in Georgia, disrupt essential workforce. The crackdown may lead to project delays and anxieties among South Korean investors, despite trade agreements and investment pledges. Visa issues and strict regulations further complicate the situation, hindering the deployment of skilled workers crucial for these projects.

title: LeBron James to Kevin Love: 3-word birthday wish; Cavs bond stays strong
content: LeBron James celebrated Kevin Love's 37th birthday with a heartfelt three-word message, "The Best Ever," highlighting their enduring bond. Their connection, forged during the Cleveland Cavaliers' 2016 NBA championship victory, remains strong. Love has also acknowledged James's support during challenging times, emphasizing their deep friendship. Their shared history of 252 games played together underscores a lasting camaraderie.

title: Lakers eye Wiggins: Heat forward on radar; after Luka Doncic deal sealed
content: The Los Angeles Lakers, after securing Luka Doncic with a 3-year extension and retaining key players, are now eyeing Andrew Wiggins from the Miami Heat to bolster their bench. With LeBron James likely returning for another season, the Lakers aim to add a versatile two-way wing to enhance their championship aspirations, potentially making them an unmatched force in the league.

title: IPL: 'I wasn't fully in the mix' - Shreyas Iyer breaks silence on his time with KKR
content: Shreyas Iyer, fresh off leading Kolkata to an IPL title in 2024, surprisingly wasn't retained and was acquired by Punjab Kings for a hefty sum. He guided Punjab to the IPL final in 2025, crediting their support for his success. Despite a recent T20 Asia Cup snub, Iyer remains focused, now captaining India A.

title: 'Tariff blackmail': Brazil's Lula slams US duties; urges 'multilateralism'
content: Brazilian President Lula da Silva has denounced U.S. tariffs as 'tariff blackmail' during a BRICS meeting, responding to a 50% import duty imposed by the U.S. He criticized the presence of U.S. forces in the Caribbean and highlighted Brazil's plan to retaliate and seek WTO intervention. Lula also launched a $5.

title: Asia Cup: Morkel warns India must adapt quickly; says Pakistan can't be taken lightly
content: Defending champions India are gearing up for the Asia Cup 2025 with intense practice sessions in Dubai, emphasising all-rounder development and fine-tuning bowling combinations. Bowling coach Morne Morkel highlights the team's focus on intensity and execution, respecting Pakistan while prioritising their own game. The team aims to leave no stone unturned in their preparation for the tournament.

title: 'It's blood money': Trump aide Navarro continues anti-India rant; attacks X again
content: Peter Navarro has intensified his criticism of India, accusing the nation of funding Russia's war through oil purchases. This tirade followed X's fact-checking of Navarro's post, which labeled India's actions as "blood money." Navarro's remarks have sparked controversy, with fact-checkers highlighting the US's own imports of Russian goods.

title: 'Heinous terrorist attack': PM Modi condemns shooting in Israel; extends condolences
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi strongly condemned the terrorist attack in Jerusalem that killed at least six civilians and wounded twelve. He conveyed India's condolences to the victims' families and reiterated India's zero-tolerance policy towards terrorism. The attack involved gunmen opening fire on a bus and commuters at a busy intersection.

title: Dhanashree Verma reacts to facing negative PR after divorce with Yuzvendra chahal
content: Dhanashree Verma, currently on 'Rise And Fall,' addressed the negative publicity following her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal. She expressed disappointment over Chahal's 'be your own sugar daddy' T-shirt at their final hearing, emphasizing the shared responsibility for respect in marriage.

title: Explained: How America’s biggest bank enabled 'superclient' Jeffrey Epstein
content: JPMorgan is not just any bank. With nearly $4 trillion in assets and operations spanning more than 100 countries, it is consistently ranked as the world’s most systemically important financial institution. Regulators and investors alike see it as a bellwether for industry standards. This makes its failings more consequential than most: when the biggest US bank overlooks red flags, it risks signalling to peers that profit can trump compliance. As the New York Times investigation shows, that was precisely the dynamic at play with Epstein.

title: J&K encounter: 2 soldiers killed; LeT terrorist among 2 eliminated
content: In the Guddar forest of Kulgam, a joint operation by the Indian Army, J&K Police, and CRPF led to an encounter with terrorists, resulting in the death of two soldiers and injuries to another. The operation, initiated based on specific intelligence, led to a fierce exchange of fire after troops challenged suspicious movement.

title: Bihar SIR: Consider Aadhaar, SC tells EC; clarifies it's not a citizenship proof
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to explore including Aadhaar as a valid identity document for Bihar's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. The court emphasized that Aadhaar should serve solely as proof of identity, not citizenship, ensuring only genuine citizens participate in voting.

title: 'Bachpan ki yaadein': Rishabh Pant shares childhood memory; gets haircut under a tree
content: Rishabh Pant recently shared a nostalgic Instagram post, reminiscing about childhood haircuts under a tree, inviting fans to share similar memories. This light-hearted moment follows a demanding series where Pant showcased resilience, scoring 479 runs, including two centuries, despite an injury during the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

title: US Open: Jannik Sinner has a Carlos Alcaraz problem and he knows it - 'I was predictable'
content: Jannik Sinner is 1-7 against Carlos Alcaraz in the last two years with the latest loss coming in the US Open final on Sunday. The Italian, for all his brutal shot-making and dominance, has struggled to find a solution to fend off the newly crowned World No. 1.

title: Vanessa Bryant shuts down rumors: Cocktail clapback at US Open
content: Vanessa Bryant playfully addressed pregnancy rumors while enjoying a cocktail at the US Open Finals in New York. She shared pictures on Instagram, twinning with her daughters Bianka and Capri, and humorously commented on the ongoing speculation. Bryant previously shut down the rumors with a social media post, emphasizing she's protecting her peace and having fun.

title: 'Friend shot in head': Nepal protests turn deadly; eyewitnesses recount clash
content: Massive protests erupted in Kathmandu against the government's social media ban, leading to violent clashes between police and demonstrators. Protesters, demanding the restoration of access to platforms like Facebook and Instagram, faced police aggression, resulting in nine deaths and numerous injuries.

title: In pics: $100 chicken nuggets, $23 cocktails at US Open
content: The US Open has evolved into a high-end lifestyle event, where extravagant food and drinks, like the $23 Honey Deuce and $100 caviar-topped chicken nuggets, overshadow the tennis itself. This "funflation" phenomenon sees attendees splurging on experiences, turning the tournament into a spectacle of consumption and Instagrammable moments, blurring the line between sport and cultural festival.

title: VP polls: 25 legal luminaries criticise Reddy-Lalu meet; call it 'dismaying'
content: A group of legal experts has strongly criticized opposition vice-presidential candidate B. Sudershan Reddy for meeting with Lalu Prasad Yadav, a politician convicted in a major corruption case. They argue that this association raises concerns about Reddy's judgment and his commitment to national interests, especially given his aspirations for high office.

title: Hazratbal row: BJP targets Rahul after Cong MP's 'what's done is done' remark
content: Following the defacement of the National Emblem in Jammu & Kashmir, a political storm has erupted. Congress leader Tariq Anwar's dismissive remark, "What's done is done," drew sharp criticism from the BJP, who accused the Congress of supporting anti-national acts. Anwar defended his statement by referencing Omar Abdullah's assertion that religious sites don't feature the Ashok Chakra.

title: Massive outrage in Nepal: 26 apps blocked including Facebook, WhatsApp - full list of banned apps
content: Nepal is facing widespread protests following the government's ban on 26 social media platforms, including Facebook, YouTube and X, due to non-compliance with registration rules. Demonstrations erupted over corruption allegations and the social media restrictions, resulting in clashes with police, leading to casualties and injuries. Prime Minister Oli defended the ban, prioritizing national independence over potential job losses.

title: Birthday party shame: MP cops filmed dancing with women performers
content: In Datia, an ASI was suspended after a video showed him dancing objectionably with women at a constable's birthday party. Similarly, in Shivpuri, another ASI faced suspension for dancing with a wanted criminal and a woman, with a beer can visible in the video. Both incidents have prompted investigations and potential further disciplinary actions.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Ex-batter issues warning — 'India need a new winning combination'
content: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has cautioned that India might face challenges in the Asia Cup 2025 due to the absence of a third all-rounder. He emphasised the importance of having multiple all-rounders, recalling India's T20 World Cup victory where Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, and Ravindra Jadeja provided crucial balance.

title: Who is Decarlos Brown Jr? Homeless offender charged in killing of Ukrainian refugee
content: Iryna Zarutska, a Ukrainian refugee seeking safety in the US, was fatally stabbed on a Charlotte light rail. Decarlos Brown Jr., a homeless man with a history of violent crime, has been charged with her murder. The incident has sparked outrage and criticism, raising concerns about public safety and the handling of repeat offenders.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Dash making moves with playoffs looming
content: our writers studied the action from across Matchday 19 to come up with this week's order of all 14 teams in the league . the current are an incredible 14-games undefeated and lead the table by a 14-point gap . it's hard to imagine anyone stopping them in pursuit of at least one trophy in 2025 .

title: 60K club: Matthew Stafford becomes 10th player to throw for 60,000 yards
content: Aaron Rodgers became the ninth quarterback to throw for 60,000 regular-season passing yards . he threw for 245 yards in the win against the Houston Texans . the los Angeles Rams chose to rest him ahead of their playoff run .

title: Sarkisian dismisses Manning health speculation
content: "remember that name, Arch Manning," a reporter says . "according to who? Arch said that to you?" the reporter responds to a question about arch Manning . the quarterback appeared to grimace as he threw the ball .

title: Which teams have clinched a playoff spot?
content: eighth teams advance to the 2025 WNBA playoffs . just one spot remains through Sunday's games . the Minnesota Lynx , Las Vegas Aces , Atlanta Dream and Phoenix Mercury will host first-round matches .

title: Power Rankings: How did each Top 25 team look in Week 2?
content: the limited sample size highlighted some possible concerns for contenders . LSU , Penn State and Georgia had a hard time pulling away from inferior competition in Week 2 . a last-minute defensive breakdown doomed the defending Big 12 champs against Mississippi State .

title: Vrabel says Belichick welcome at Patriots facility
content: bill Belichick bans scouts at the university of north Carolina . the six-time super bowl-winning coach says he's welcome at the facility . belichick says it's "obvious I'm not welcome at their facility"

title: ✈️ Steelers' jab at Jets tops NFL Week 1 trolls
content: Steelers QB Aaron Rodgers threw for 244 yards and four touchdowns in 34-32 win . Jets quarterback Justin Fields accounted for 266 yards and three touchdowns . the Steelers also turned off the airplane mode function on an iPhone .

title: Waiver wire: The key players to add before Week 2
content: each Monday, before the current NFL week ends, we will identify players available in at least 50% of ESPN standard leagues worthy of your attention . the season has kicked off but there's still time to start fresh with a 0-0 record . RB Bijan Robinson saw a mere 12 rushing attempts and Penix wasn't known as an runner .

title: What happened to Oklahoma State? Is USF the team to watch?
content: the ACC and Big Ten show they have multiple teams in contention for the college football playoff . south Florida beat yet another AP Top 25 team and Oklahoma State suffered its biggest loss in over 100 years . our college football experts break down key takeaways from Week 2 performances .

title: AP Week 2 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: four AP-ranked teams outscored their opponents by a combined 307-26 . four ranked teams scored 70 or more points, the second time in the AP poll era . it's the longest streak to begin a game in school history .

title: How Missouri's pair of five-star recruits fit, plus more 2026 commitment breakdowns
content: a total of 18 five-stars are atop the ESPN 100 player rankings for the men's college basketball class of 2026 . three are off the board as of early September . most recently, no. 12 JaShawn Andrews was the first of this group, announcing his commitment to Arkansas .
